definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to be called/to be known as
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to complain without stopping (idiom); to bitch endlessly/incessant grievances

sentences.english: Lets go to the cinema together, and Ill call for you.
sentences.chinese: 咱們一起去看電影吧，到時候我來叫你。

sentences.english: And when Owl hooted , Bluebird could not sleep.
sentences.chinese: 當貓頭鷹叫的時候，知更鳥睡不着。

sentences.english: Please tell the boy not barge about the room.
sentences.chinese: 請叫那男孩別在房間裏亂碰亂撞。

sentences.english: Cats and snakes are traditionally cooked together (in the south only), given the name "dragon tiger fight".
sentences.chinese: 貓和蛇通常一起做，名字叫“龍虎鬥”。

sentences.english: And this is "Da Luo", it is a big gong.
sentences.chinese: 這個叫“大鑼”，是鑼的一種。
我很氣，叫了他一聲“死納粹”。

sentences.english: Urn on the outside, as well as a city, called East Rochester.
sentences.chinese: 甕城的外面，還有一座城，叫做東羅城。

sentences.english: Occasionally, by now, Is lipped and called him Scampy.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我說漏嘴，也叫它“小淘氣”。

sentences.english: Next time have her telephone you.
sentences.chinese: 下一次叫她給你打磙電話。

sentences.english: I made/had him copy the lesson 20 times.
sentences.chinese: 我叫他把這篇課文抄寫20遍。

sentences.english: There were laughter and song in the air.
sentences.chinese: 麻雀在吱吱喳喳地叫着，空氣中飄蕩着歡歌笑語。

sentences.english: He even calls her by a cute nickname, "Snips."
sentences.chinese: 他甚至用一個可愛的暱稱，“小鬼頭”來叫她。

sentences.english: Third category called" little wife" middle, be a yes-man, like a doormat.
sentences.chinese: 第三類叫“小媳婦型”中層，唯唯諾諾，像個受氣包。

sentences.english: Noon because of the "Chen-yang", so end of the five also called the "Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 又因午時爲“陽辰”，所以端五也叫“端陽”。

sentences.english: A naughty monkey is yellow, yellow teeth.
sentences.chinese: 小猴更調皮，叫小黃“黃牙小子”。

definition: to be called/to be known as
name (of a person or thing)/CL:個|个[ge4]
pet name for a child/childhood name
(emphasizes that sth is precisely or exactly as stated)/precisely/exactly/even/if/just like/in the same way as
to name/to be named/to christen/to seek fame
to yell/to shout/to call out for (a person)
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
pet name for a child/infant name
